Column Comment.0: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.
Column Comment.1: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.2: MINERAL ZONE ID: unique identifier for the mineral zone that is included in thespatial description
Column Comment.3: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH : The depth at which the bottom of the substance exclusion is valid, asdetermined by the lessor.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The original units used, usually feetor meters.
Column Comment.7: TOP QUALIFIER: A qualification for describing where in a stratigraphic unit a landright has or will be granted, such as from the TOP of the AAA to the TOP of the BBBor the TOP of the AAA to the BASE of the BBB etc. Usual values will be top andbase.
Column Comment.8: BASE STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphicunit that is at the base of the land zone.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the substance was first included or excluded fromthe land mineral rights.
Column Comment.10: SUBSTANCE EXCLUDED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that this substanceis not included in the land mineral rights. This information is generally not provided bythe agreement, but may be added to facilitate queries as needed.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.12: SUBSTANCE INCLUDED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that this substanceis explicitly included in the land mineral rights.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.17: TOP DEPTH: The depth at which the top of the substance exclusion is valid, asdetermined by the lessor.
Column Comment.18: TOP DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The original units used, usually feetor meters.
Column Comment.19: TOP QUALIFIER: A qualification for describing where in a stratigraphic unit a landright has or will be granted, such as from the TOP of the AAA to the TOP of the BBBor the TOP of the AAA to the BASE of the BBB etc. Usual values will be top andbase.
Column Comment.20: TOP STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unitthat is at the top of the land zone.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
